title: Error: Invalid Command Line + Failure to Startup
body:
Whenever I start my computer, League attempts to launch as part of startup protocol.

However, when it does I get the error message - Error: Invalid Command Line. Then it shuts off.

Secondarily, on an irregular occurrence League of Legends flashes the logos then doesn't start at all, when I check my Task Manager, there are 3 different LoL Patchers running at the same time.

Anyone know what to do about this?

P.S. I'd prefer an answer quickly, this has been happening ever since I re-installed the LoL client roughly 2 weeks ago.

replies.body:
Hey Black k 9,

Thanks for the report.  I can look into this a bit, but you might be able to do a temporary fix by repairing the client from the settings menu in the upper right or manually forcing a patch.  To manually force a patch follow the below steps:

1. Go to your League of Legends folder (ex. C:\Riot Games\League of Legends)
2. Open your RADS folder
3. Open the projects folder
4. Open the league_client folder
5. Open the releases folder
6. Inside the releases folder, delete the numbered folder (ex. format 0.0.X.X)

Note: THIS WILL FORCE A PATCH! If that is not the route you'd like to take, I would refrain from doing that and we can work towards a better solution.

Additionally, I will raise the start up error issue with the rest of the team for additional visibility.
hello i have the same broblem but i dont know how to fix can you help me guys?
i have delete league of leagend bcz i have some broblem and i delete all files..now i cant download again any help?
